text: An election to Monaghan County Council took place on 27 June 1991 as part of that year's Irish local elections. 20 councillors were elected from four electoral divisions by PR-STV voting for a five-year term of office. ==Results by party== {| class=wikitable ! colspan=2 align=center|Party ! valign=top|Seats ! valign=top|± ! valign=top|First Pref. votes ! valign=top|FPv% ! valign=top|±% |- | align=right|8 | align=right|-2 | align=right|9,777 | align=right|40.12% | align=right| |- | align=right|7 | align=right|- | align=right|7,981 | align=right|32.75% | align=right| |- | align=right|2 | align=right|- | align=right|3,396 | align=right|13.94% | align=right| |- | align=right|3 | align=right|+2 | align=right|2,964 | align=right|12.16% | align=right| |- | colspan=2 align=center|Totals | align=right |20 | align=center|- | align=right |24,367 | align=center|100% | align=center|— |} ==Results by Electoral Area== ===Carrickmacross=== ===Castleblayney=== ===Clones=== ===Monaghan=== ==External links== * Official website * Irishelectionliterature 1991 Category:Monaghan County Council elections
title: 1991 Monaghan County Council election
